title: BUG: random_state in shap.utils.sample not preserved between v0.41.0 -> v0.42.1

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behaviour

body:
### Issue Description

The result of `shap.utils.sample` function is changing even when the default random_state in https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/generated/shap.utils.sample.html. I tried to find the cause of it on shap side, but didn't have much time to dig deeper for now.

I might be interested in making PR. However I don't have much time following days, I will see however what I can do.

### Minimal Reproducible Example

```python
import pandas as pd
from shap.utils import sample

X = pd.DataFrame([{'col_3': 1}, {'col_3': 0}, {'col_3': 0}, {'col_3': 0}])
masker = sample(X, 1, random_state=0)
masker.to_dict(orient="records")

# v0.41.0
# [{'col_3': 1}]

# v0.42.1
# [{'col_3': 0}]

# master b9598d5132c502d1c5368d4f517f77c0711e1c47
# [{'col_3': 0}]
```


### Traceback

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

How does it affect us? In case that tests in other packages rely on shap values calculated on a small dataset it is an issue. In case of great size of mask created by `sample` it doesn't have a marginal effect marginally speaking. However, I believe such function should not change their output with minor releases unless it is necessary. 

### Bug report checklist

- [X] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported.
- [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest release](https://github.com/shap/shap/releases) of shap.
- [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [master branch](https://github.com/shap/shap/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#installing-from-the-master-branch) of shap.
- [ ] I'd be interested in making a PR to fix this bug
